entries.name: AI Infrastructure
entries.description: Core infrastructure and foundational technologies that enable AI development and deployment. Includes hardware, cloud services, data infrastructure, security tools, and development frameworks.

entries.name: AI Compute Hardware
entries.description: Specialized hardware and computing systems designed for AI workloads, including GPUs, TPUs, and other AI accelerators. Enables efficient training and inference of AI models.

entries.name: Cloud & Edge Infrastructure
entries.description: Cloud platforms and edge computing solutions optimized for AI workloads. Provides scalable computing resources and deployment environments for AI applications.

entries.name: Data Infrastructure
entries.description: Tools and platforms for data collection, storage, processing, and management. Essential for training and operating AI systems at scale.

entries.name: AI Security & Observability
entries.description: Solutions for securing AI systems, monitoring model performance, and ensuring reliable operation of AI applications in production.

entries.name: AI Dev Tools & Frameworks
entries.description: Development frameworks, libraries, and tools that streamline the creation and deployment of AI applications. Includes ML frameworks, model development tools, and deployment platforms.

entries.name: AI Models & Platforms
entries.description: Core AI models, platforms, and services that power AI applications. Includes foundation models, model APIs, repositories, and optimization tools.

entries.name: Foundation Models
entries.description: Large-scale AI models trained on broad data that can be adapted to various tasks. Includes language models, vision models, and multimodal models.

entries.name: Model APIs & Serving
entries.description: Services and platforms that provide access to AI models through APIs and handle model deployment, scaling, and serving.

entries.name: Model Hubs & Repositories
entries.description: Platforms for sharing, discovering, and collaborating on AI models. Includes model marketplaces and open-source repositories.

entries.name: Model Compression & Optimization
entries.description: Tools and techniques for optimizing AI models for efficiency, including quantization, pruning, and knowledge distillation.

entries.name: AI Applications & Services
entries.description: End-user applications and services that leverage AI to solve specific problems or provide value in various domains. Includes both consumer and enterprise solutions.

entries.name: Autonomous Agents
entries.description: AI systems that can operate independently to achieve specific goals. Includes virtual assistants, autonomous vehicles, and robotic systems.

entries.name: Enterprise Automation
entries.description: AI solutions for automating business processes, improving efficiency, and enabling data-driven decision making in enterprises.

entries.name: Healthcare AI
entries.description: AI applications in healthcare, including diagnostic tools, treatment planning, drug discovery, and patient care management.

entries.name: eCommerce & Personalization
entries.description: AI solutions for e-commerce, including recommendation systems, personalization engines, and customer experience optimization.

entries.name: Robotics & IoT
entries.description: AI-powered robotics systems and IoT applications that combine hardware and software for physical world interaction.

entries.name: Education Technology
entries.description: AI applications in education, including adaptive learning systems, educational content generation, and student performance analytics.

entries.name: Financial Services & FinTech
entries.description: AI solutions for financial services, including fraud detection, risk assessment, algorithmic trading, and financial planning.

entries.name: Marketing & Advertising
entries.description: AI tools for marketing and advertising, including customer segmentation, campaign optimization, and content generation.

entries.name: Creative & Content Generation
entries.description: AI systems for creative tasks, including text generation, image creation, music composition, and video production.

entries.name: AI Governance & Ethics
entries.description: Tools, frameworks, and services for ensuring responsible AI development and deployment. Includes auditing, fairness, privacy, safety, and policy solutions.

entries.name: AI Auditing & Compliance
entries.description: Tools and services for auditing AI systems, ensuring compliance with regulations, and maintaining documentation and traceability.

entries.name: Fairness & Bias Mitigation
entries.description: Solutions for detecting and mitigating bias in AI systems, ensuring fair treatment across different demographic groups.

entries.name: Privacy & Data Protection
entries.description: Tools and frameworks for protecting privacy in AI systems, including data anonymization, federated learning, and privacy-preserving AI.

entries.name: Safety & Risk Management
entries.description: Solutions for ensuring AI system safety, managing risks, and preventing harmful outcomes in AI applications.

entries.name: Policy & Regulatory Frameworks
entries.description: Tools and services for implementing and complying with AI policies and regulations, including governance frameworks and compliance solutions.

mappings.name: Global Industry Classification Standard
mappings.description: The Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS) is an industry taxonomy developed by MSCI and S&P Dow Jones Indices for use by the global financial community.

gics_codes.name: Application Software
gics_codes.description: Companies engaged in developing and producing software designed for specialized applications for the business or consumer market.

gics_codes.name: Systems Software
gics_codes.description: Companies engaged in developing and producing systems and database management software.

gics_codes.name: Application Software
gics_codes.description: Companies engaged in developing and producing software designed for specialized applications for the business or consumer market.

gics_codes.name: Application Software
gics_codes.description: Companies engaged in developing and producing software designed for specialized applications for the business or consumer market.

gics_codes.name: IT Consulting & Other Services
gics_codes.description: Companies providing IT consulting services, information management services, and data processing services.

gics_codes.name: IT Consulting & Other Services
gics_codes.description: Companies providing IT consulting services, information management services, and data processing services.

mappings.name: North American Industry Classification System
mappings.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is the standard used by Federal statistical agencies in classifying business establishments for the purpose of collecting, analyzing, and publishing statistical data related to the U.S. business economy.

naics_codes.name: Software Publishers
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in computer software publishing or publishing and reproduction.

naics_codes.name: Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in providing infrastructure for hosting or data processing services.

naics_codes.name: Software Publishers
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in computer software publishing or publishing and reproduction.

naics_codes.name: Software Publishers
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in computer software publishing or publishing and reproduction.

naics_codes.name: Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in conducting research and experimental development in the physical, engineering, and life sciences.

naics_codes.name: Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences
naics_codes.description: This industry comprises establishments primarily engaged in conducting research and experimental development in the physical, engineering, and life sciences.

mappings.name: International Standard Industrial Classification
mappings.description: The International Standard Industrial Classification (ISIC) is the international reference classification of productive economic activities. Its main purpose is to provide a set of activity categories that can be utilized for the collection and reporting of statistics according to such activities.

isic_codes.name: Computer programming activities
isic_codes.description: This class includes the writing, modifying, testing and supporting of software.

isic_codes.name: Data processing, hosting and related activities
isic_codes.description: This class includes the provision of infrastructure for hosting, data processing services and related activities.

isic_codes.name: Computer programming activities
isic_codes.description: This class includes the writing, modifying, testing and supporting of software.

isic_codes.name: Computer programming activities
isic_codes.description: This class includes the writing, modifying, testing and supporting of software.

isic_codes.name: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering
isic_codes.description: This class includes research and experimental development activities in natural sciences and engineering.

isic_codes.name: Research and experimental development on natural sciences and engineering
isic_codes.description: This class includes research and experimental development activities in natural sciences and engineering.
